Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Exercise in Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to an exercise group (n=33) or a usual care group (n=32) using computer-generated random numbers.

Participants.evidence: 65 patients with small AAAs, recruited from a cardiovascular clinic.

Intervention.evidence: The exercise group underwent a supervised program of aerobic and resistance training.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in AAA size over 12 months.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to participants or clinicians, but outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to an exercise group (n=33) or a usual care group (n=32)

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was performed on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The exercise group showed no significant difference in AAA growth compared to the control group (mean difference = 0.2 mm/year, 95% CI -0.5 to 0.9; p=0.45).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.

Funding.evidence: This study was funded by the National Institute of Health.
